example.eg: Irene glided over the dance floor with the grace of a figure skater.
example.egtrans: 艾琳宛如花样滑冰运动员一般优雅地滑过舞池。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 优雅, 雅致, 雅致

example.eg: The congregation prayed for God's grace and mercy.
example.egtrans: 会众为上帝的恩典和怜悯祷告。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.guideword: (prayer before or after meal) (饭前或饭后的)

example.eg: Jim's father always said grace before every meal.
example.egtrans: 吉姆的父亲每顿饭钱都会做餐前祷告。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.guideword: usually capitalized (title) (大主教、公爵、公爵夫人的尊称)

example.eg: His Grace appeared at the king's court last week.
example.egtrans: 上周，公爵大人在国王的宫廷出现过。

example.eg: Many rare and beautiful treasures graced the museum.
example.egtrans: 众多美丽的奇珍异宝为博物馆增光添彩。

example.eg: The mayor graced the villagers with his presence at the ceremony.
example.egtrans: 市长给村民赏光，莅临仪式活动。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 参与...莅临, 给...赏光参加

example.eg: Janine named her new daughter Grace.
The rumors about the actor's infidelity triggered his fall from grace.
Once the party got into power and it became clear it would not fulfil its election promises, it fell from grace.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 为使情节更有吸引力而加入的细节

example.eg: By the grace of God, you will be healed.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 上帝的恩赐, 上帝的怜悯

dsense.name: grace period
dsense.guideword: (time allowed before penalty) (票据到期后的)

example.eg: Some student loans have a six-month grace period; then you have to start paying them back.
The script and the acting are terrible; the amazing period costumes are the play's only saving grace.

dsense.name: two days grace, two days' grace

example.eg: The electric company gave us two days grace to pay the bill before disconnecting our service.
